instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spins high and slow
threads.message:
I now working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no signs of water damage and really looks like new.
EFI shows tsOp error and reading -124
Tried new trackpad and cables with no change 
Connector looks like new 

All hints I can find are measurement on pin 19 shows 0.502 in doide mode and should be around 0.640

New to this problem and help needed =)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan spins high and slow
threads.message:
Checked <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5371</RESISTOR> and the same measurements in diode mode
Removed the silicone around SMC and put some flux around it then a quick heat up.

Now measurements seems fine 0.637 in diode mode and tsOp error are gone.

Some testing left
